the of the American State on display
here today as you'd expect for a former

Prince Charles will be there
representing the Queen others like the

they will to listen to as you said the

for the nation where where he tries to

and and at the end after it's all done
and dusted they will transport the

outside of the city to be flown back to
Texas for a funeral tomorrow
and internment at the presidential
library in College Station in Texas the
current president Donald Trump has
tweeted in the last half-hour he said
looking forward to being with the Bush
family this is not a funeral this is a
day of celebration for a great man who's
led along a distinguished life he will
be missed from a man these two didn't
necessarily see eye to eye no indeed
when we know from a biography oh there's
probably the most authoritative
biography of bush senior that he didn't
vote for Donald Trump in the election he
voted for Hillary Clinton we're told by
his biographer there was a lot of
animosity between the Trump family and
the bushes we know that indeed and and
on the campaign trail Donald Trump
really took issue with the made fun in
in many ways of George Bush Senior and
particularly if he's sort of thousand
points of light speech that that the
former president had made back during
his campaigning days so and they
represent of course two very very
different branches of the Republican
Party and Trump very much a sort of an
insurgent a man who's taken over the
Republican Party's party turned it in
many ways into his own image George Bush
Senior of course representing a much
more old-style patrician more
conciliatory more bipartisan form of
republicanism that held Swain really
until I guess until the late eighties in
the early nineties things had already
begun to change under him and what a
Reagan had seen to that and even an
earlier generation people like Barry
Goldwater had tried to do something
similar with moving the Republican Party
right but really towards the end of
George Bush Senior there was a definite
shift to the right
evangelical influence and then of course

ascendancy of people like Newt Gingrich
and a real a real push to the right by

wouldn't sit easily in the Republican
Party
of today so Gary let's just join the 70

and Gary is the coffin is loaded onto

mean this is say an intensely in many
ways an intensely public family it's a

this is them living out and and going

it's a it must be a very difficult

will want to be having their own private

and they know at the same time this is a

and that will be that would be something
obviously that they want they will
cherish very much but very much today
this is it is in many ways the nation's
the nation's moment to mark the passing

about some of the things he was
criticized for and and some in some ways
one of the rarities in the modern era a
president who didn't make a second term
in office but also someone who who
presided over some very key moments in

the end of the Cold War he was president
when the Berlin Wall came down he

of course the end of the Gulf
or golf or in that presence and the end
